Create metadata templates

Source: vignettes/create_metadata_templates.Rmd
create_metadata_templates.Rmd

Templating functions

Metadata templates store content that is converted into EML. Each template is created by a templating function that reads a data entity or object, extracts as much information as possible from data entity or object, then writes this information to file for the user to add information to if necessary. Each templating function focuses on a specific metadata feature thereby allowing the user to highlight the unique features of their data. Currently available functions include:

  • template_core_metadata Create core metadata templates required by all data packages (abstract, methods, keywords, personnel, license) along with some optional templates (additional information, custom units).
  • template_table_attributes Create attribute metadata for data tables, including column definitions, classes, and missing value codes.
  • template_categorical_variables Create categorical variable metadata for data tables containing columns of categorical class.
  • template_geographic_coverage Create geographic coverage describing sampling points and areas.
  • template_taxonomic_coverage Create taxonomic coverage metadata including resolution of taxa to authority systems and return of higher rank orders.

Below is a demonstration of each function and a look at outputs.

template_core_metadata

# Set working directory

setwd('/Users/Colin/Desktop/data_packages/edi_301')

# Create core templates

template_core_metadata(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  license = 'CC0'
)

# View directory

dir('./metadata_templates')
## [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
## [3] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
## [5] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
## [7] "personnel.txt"

template_table_attributes

# Create templates for table attributes

template_table_attributes(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  data.path = './data_objects',
  data.table = c('decomp.csv', 'nitrogen.csv')
)

# View directory

dir('./metadata_templates')
## [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
## [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
## [5] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
## [7] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
## [9] "personnel.txt"
# View templates
# NOTE: attributeName and class are autogenerated, and unit and dateTimeFormatString note where specific content is needed.
attributes_decomp.txt
attributeName attributeDefinition class unit dateTimeFormatString missingValueCode missingValueCodeExplanation
type categorical
date Date !Add datetime specifier here!
arm numeric !Add units here!
ntrt categorical
year Date !Add datetime specifier here!
percent_loss numeric !Add units here!
taxa character
attributes_nitrogen.txt
attributeName attributeDefinition class unit dateTimeFormatString missingValueCode missingValueCodeExplanation
date Date !Add datetime specifier here!
ntrt categorical
arm numeric !Add units here!
net_primary_production numeric !Add units here!
stem_mass_density numeric !Add units here!
plant_density numeric !Add units here!
stem_n_concentration numeric !Add units here!
n_assimilated numeric !Add units here!
site_name character
site_lon numeric !Add units here!
site_lat numeric !Add units here!

template_categorical variables

# Create templates for categorical variables

template_categorical_variables(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  data.path = './data_objects'
)

# View directory

dir('./metadata_templates')
##  [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
##  [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
##  [5] "catvars_decomp.txt"      "catvars_nitrogen.txt"   
##  [7] "custom_units.txt"        "intellectual_rights.txt"
##  [9] "keywords.txt"            "methods.txt"            
## [11] "personnel.txt"
# View templates
# NOTE: attributeName and code is autogenerated.
catvars_decomp.txt
attributeName code definition
type Sphagnum
type Vascular
ntrt C
ntrt 0
ntrt 5
ntrt 10
ntrt 15
ntrt 20
ntrt 25
catvars_nitrogen.txt
attributeName code definition
ntrt C
ntrt 0
ntrt 5
ntrt 10
ntrt 15
ntrt 20
ntrt 25

template_geographic_coverage

# Create geographic coverage template

template_geographic_coverage(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  data.path = './data_objects',
  data.table = 'nitrogen.csv',
  site.col = 'site_name',
  lat.col = 'site_lat',
  lon.col = 'site_lon'
)

# View directory

dir('./metadata_templates')
##  [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
##  [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
##  [5] "catvars_decomp.txt"      "catvars_nitrogen.txt"   
##  [7] "custom_units.txt"        "geographic_coverage.txt"
##  [9] "intellectual_rights.txt" "keywords.txt"           
## [11] "methods.txt"             "personnel.txt"
# View template

template_taxonomic_coverage

# Create taxonomic coverage template

template_taxonomic_coverage(
  path = './metadata_templates',
  data.path = './data_objects',
  taxa.table = 'decomp.csv',
  taxa.col = 'taxa',
  taxa.authority = c(3,11),
  taxa.name.type = 'both'
)

# View directory

dir('./metadata_templates')
##  [1] "abstract.txt"            "additional_info.txt"    
##  [3] "attributes_decomp.txt"   "attributes_nitrogen.txt"
##  [5] "catvars_decomp.txt"      "catvars_nitrogen.txt"   
##  [7] "custom_units.txt"        "geographic_coverage.txt"
##  [9] "intellectual_rights.txt" "keywords.txt"           
## [11] "methods.txt"             "personnel.txt"          
## [13] "taxonomic_coverage.txt"
# View template
# NOTE: Unresolved taxa lack authority information
taxonomic_coverage.txt
name name_type name_resolved authority_system authority_id
